result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan M Poblitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
Sentence credit of 111 days were granted. Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision

Defendant to comply with Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha. Comply with Anger Management.

Restitution was set to zero. No Contact with Victim A. Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Hearing on June 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:22 AM Defendant Alan M Poblitz in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Wolff sent in a letter requesting the Victim be produced from the Waukesha County Jail.
The Court will recess at 09:24 AM to produce Victim A.
The Court recalls the matter at 09:31 AM with the same appearances and Victim A now present. 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Jan Corrigan, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Tempelis.
Cross examination by attorney Wolff.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
Victim A sworn in and testifies on direct by attorney Wolff.
Cross examination by ADA Tempelis.
The witness is excused and the Defense rests.
The State recalls officer Corrigan in rebuttal and testifies on direct by ADA Tempelis.
Cross examination by attorney Wolff.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND ENTERED.
VICTIM A WOULD LIKE TO APPEAR FOR THE NEXT HEARING BUT MAY BE IN CUSTODY AT THE PORTAGE COUNTY JAIL SO A VIDEO OR PHONE WILL NEED TO BE SET UP OR MAY BE BACK IN THE WAUKESHA COUNTY JAIL.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Atty Peter Wolff request Victim A to be produced in court at prelim hearing on 6/08/2022.

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 06/02/22--no action by the Court - filed as informational only.**
